document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_title: Information Security for Use of Cloud Services
control.control_purpose: To specify and manage information security for use of cloud services
control.control_objective: Establish processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services in accordance with information security requirements

iso_27001_definition.official_text: Processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services should be established in accordance with the organisation's information security requirements.
key_requirements: Process for using cloud services securely

cloud_services_overview.definition: Cloud services are computing resources and applications delivered over the internet, hosted and managed by external providers
cloud_services_overview.treatment: Cloud services treated as suppliers subject to standard supplier management processes
cloud_services_overview.key_challenge: Cloud service agreements typically non-negotiable and pre-defined by providers
cloud_services_overview.standard_acknowledgment: ISO 27001 acknowledges that cloud agreements are largely non-negotiable and full alignment with requirements often not feasible
cloud_services_overview.practical_approach: Apply good supplier management practices within constraints of cloud provider offerings

implementation_requirements.description: Define process for evaluating and acquiring cloud services

acquisition_process: Define security requirements for cloud services
Assess provider security posture and certifications
Identify non-negotiable items vs. negotiable items
details.key_point: Recognize constraints - cloud agreements largely take-it-or-leave-it

implementation_requirements.description: Establish security requirements for cloud services before acquisition

security_requirements: Encryption requirements (in transit and at rest)
details.criticality: Adjust requirements based on cloud service criticality

implementation_requirements.description: Assess cloud providers for security capabilities and suitability

details.trade-offs: Understand where provider does not meet all requirements

implementation_requirements.description: Review and understand cloud service agreement terms

details.documentation: Document what is negotiable vs. non-negotiable
details.constraints: Understand constraints of provider's standard agreement

implementation_requirements.description: Recognize and document cloud agreement items that cannot be negotiated

details.non_negotiable_recognition: Cloud providers offer standard agreements with minimal negotiation flexibility
approach: Focus negotiation on critical items only
details.decision: Accept or find alternative provider if non-negotiable items unacceptable

implementation_requirements.description: Define how cloud services will be used securely

secure_use_practices: Data classification to determine what can be stored in cloud
Encryption of sensitive data before cloud storage
Network segmentation and VPN if needed
details.configuration: Configure cloud service securely per provider options

implementation_requirements.description: Monitor and manage cloud services for continued security

details.automation: Use monitoring and alerting where available

implementation_requirements.description: Monitor and manage changes made by cloud provider

details.impact_assessment: Assess impact of changes to security
details.response: Update configurations or usage based on changes

implementation_requirements.requirement: Implement Incident Response with Cloud Provider
implementation_requirements.description: Establish incident response procedures with cloud provider
Establish process for exiting cloud service when needed

exit_planning: Timeline for data removal from provider

implementation_requirements.requirement: Include Cloud Services in Supplier Management
implementation_requirements.description: Apply standard supplier management processes to cloud services

details.supplier_management_alignment: Cloud services managed as cloud supplier relationships
details.reference: See controls 5.19 (Supplier Relationships), 5.20 (Supplier Agreements), 5.21 (ICT Supply Chain), 5.22 (Monitor and Review)

implementation_requirements.description: Maintain inventory of cloud services in use

cloud_service_lifecycle.description: Typical lifecycle stages for cloud service management

stages.name: Negotiation and Agreement
stages.description: Negotiate and finalize cloud service agreement

cloud_vs_traditional_supplier.description: Differences in managing cloud services vs. traditional suppliers

differences.cloud_service: Services standardized - must adapt to service

differences.traditional_supplier: May have audit access to facilities
differences.cloud_service: Limited - rely on provider's certifications and reporting
Data stored on provider's infrastructure - must use their security

differences.traditional_supplier: Usually can switch with reasonable notice
differences.cloud_service: Data migration can be complex - vendor lock-in risk
Standard SLAs - must accept provider's terms

steps.detail: Document organization's approach to cloud service security
Identify all cloud services currently in use
Establish security requirements for cloud services
Assess existing and potential cloud providers
Document key terms and constraints of cloud agreements
Configure cloud services securely per available options
Set up monitoring and logging for cloud services
Document exit and data migration procedures
Add cloud services to supplier management processes

compliance_checklist.description: Steps to comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.23

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with cloud service security

mistakes.description: No ongoing monitoring or oversight of cloud services
root_cause: Assumption cloud provider handles all security
Focus on implementation, not ongoing management
mistakes.impact: Security issues not detected, incidents not noticed, compliance gaps not identified
mistakes.prevention: Establish monitoring process with clear responsibility
mistakes.evidence_needed: Be able to demonstrate monitoring of cloud services

mistakes.mistake: No assurance cloud provider maintains security
mistakes.description: No verification of cloud provider security posture
root_cause: Initial evaluation done but no ongoing verification
mistakes.evidence_needed: Current certification (ISO 27001, SOC 2, etc.) covering services in use
mistakes.action: Request annual compliance updates from cloud provider

mistakes.mistake: Document and version control is wrong
mistakes.description: Poor documentation of cloud services and agreements
issues: No record of security controls provided

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 5.23 audit

audit_areas.description: Verify agreements exist and are documented
checks: Agreement exists for each cloud service

audit_areas.description: Verify cloud services monitored and managed
Verify cloud services managed as suppliers

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: Cloud services are increasingly used to support gambling systems - must manage security and compliance requirements carefully

cloud_security_requirements: UK data residency if storing customer data

ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: Operators must establish and maintain processes for secure acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services in accordance with security requirements

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Establish processes for cloud service acquisition, use, management and exit that maintain agreed information security standards
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: High - cloud services now integral to most gambling operations
key_principles: Define cloud security requirements before acquisition
Understand agreement constraints and non-negotiable items
Apply supplier management processes to cloud
Track and respond to cloud service changes
Plan for cloud service exit and data migration
Document all cloud service decisions and controls
Recognize constraints - many cloud terms are non-negotiable

to_pass_the_audit.description: To comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.23 Information Security for Use of Cloud Services, implement

requirements.detail: Document approach to cloud service security
Establish minimum security standards for cloud services
Document terms and identify non-negotiable items
Enable security features provided by cloud provider
Encrypt sensitive data before cloud storage
Monitor cloud service performance and security
Restrict access to cloud services appropriately
Document data migration and exit procedures
Apply supplier management processes to cloud services
Document all cloud services in Supplier Register
Monitor cloud provider certifications and updates

prerequisite_controls: ISO 27001 A 5.19 - Information security in supplier relationships
ISO 27001 A 5.20 - Addressing information security within supplier agreements
ISO 27001 A 5.21 - Managing information security in the ICT supply chain
ISO 27001 A 5.22 - Monitor, review and change management of supplier services
cross_references: Supplier Relationships (A 5.19) - cloud services managed as suppliers
ICT Supply Chain (A 5.21) - cloud infrastructure and components
Supplier Monitoring (A 5.22) - ongoing cloud service management

negotiation_best_practices: Accept provider's standard terms where appropriate
configuration_best_practices: Use VPN or private connectivity where available
exit_best_practices: Plan exit strategy before vendor lock-in occurs

critical_cloud_considerations.action: Verify cloud provider stores data in UK or acceptable jurisdiction

critical_cloud_considerations.importance: PCI DSS requirements for payment data
critical_cloud_considerations.action: Ensure cloud provider is PCI DSS certified or compliant

critical_cloud_considerations.importance: Game fairness verification in cloud environment
critical_cloud_considerations.action: Verify RNG security and audit trail in cloud configuration
Ensure cloud service maintains audit trail for regulatory reporting
Verify cloud provider's backup and disaster recovery capabilities

regulatory_expectations: UKGC expects documented cloud service evaluation
Evidence of security certification or assessment
